-   **Rarity note:** Common swallowtail butterfly species found in woodlands, scrub, and forest margins in the Southeastern United States.

## Natural history notes

Zebra Swallowtails (Eurytides marcellus) are characterized by their 'zebra-like' patterning of black and white stripes. The hindwing has a red spot followed by blue scales leading to the long white-tipped tail. Their hostplant is the Pawpaw (Asimina spp.). They can be found in flight from February to November.
